thread.title: Little boy saved from drowning by heroic bystanders as panicking parents just couldn't get to him in time
thread.title_full: Little boy saved from drowning by heroic bystanders as panicking parents just couldn't get to him in time

author: Kelly-Ann Mills
title: Little boy saved from drowning by heroic bystanders as panicking parents just couldn't get to him in time
text:
News Little boy saved from drowning by heroic bystanders as panicking parents just couldn't get to him in time WARNING, DISTRESSING CONTENT. Youngster tired to crawl up the beach out of the water but is swept out and his parents unare able to get to him as he goes under the water Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Terrifying moment young boy gets washed out to sea Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A little boy who was happily playing in the water was suddenly pulled out to sea as his parents watched in horror. 
A man, wearing shorts is shouting to the boy and giving instructions, as the youngster tired to crawl up the beach out of the water. 
But the child was getting dragged backwards. 
A woman, spotting the danger on the Hawaiian beach, came running into the shot and towards the child. The boy is being dragged backwards out to sea (Photo: DailyPicksandFlicks/Liveleak) Read More 
But she failed to get to him in time and the boy started to go under. 
Three bystanders then came running in across the beach and managed to get to the child. Read More Astonishing rescue footage captures moment OAP scuba diver plucked from shark-infested waters after 17 HOURS adrift alone Heroic passersby ran out to grab the boy (Photo: DailyPicksandFlicks/Liveleak) 
They were all unable to keep on their feet and fell over more than once as they brought the youngster back to safety. 
Eventually one person staggers out and puts the boy back on his feet up the beach. Read More 
The footage was uploaded to video sharing website LiveLeak just seven hours ago and has already been viewed more than 10,000 times. Like us on Facebook
